subject: Philosophy
title: Descartes's Dualism
description: A short lesson to help you apply Descartes's Dualism.

hook.text: Descartes said the mind is one thing and the body is another. Simple â€” and deeply problematic.

buildup.text: He argued the mind is non-physical, thinking substance. The body is physical, extended substance.

discovery.text: This 'substance dualism' seems intuitive. We feel like a ghost driving a machine.

twist.text: But if mind and body are different substances, how do they interact? How does a thought move an arm?

climax.text: Descartes pointed to the pineal gland. Modern neuroscience finds that answer laughably wrong.

punchline.text: The ghost in the machine still haunts philosophy.

quiz.question: What is the main problem with Descartes's dualism?
options: Explaining how a non-physical mind interacts with a physical body
The mind is just the brain
